Name: Romans
History: The Romans controlled one of the largest empires of the ancient world, stretching at its peak from southern Scotland to the Sahara Desert, and containing between 60 million and 80 million inhabitants, one quarter of the Earth's population at that time. Rome also remained one of the strongest nations on earth for almost 800 years. The Romans were the supreme builders of the ancient world, excelled at siege warfare and had an exquisite infantry and navy.

Technologies.Name: Marian Reforms
Technologies.History: Gaius Marius turned the roman legions into a professional force.
Technologies.Description: Infantry Swordsmen are upgraded to Marian Legionaries and several units are replaced or unlocked.

Technologies.Name: Logistics
Technologies.History: Roman skill in military logistics and their large manpower pool allowed them to quickly mobilize forces and replace loses.

Technologies.Name: Gladius Hispaniensis
Technologies.History: Introduction of the Iberian Gladius shortsword increased Roman infantry effectiveness.

Heroes.Name: Consular Bodyguard
Heroes.History: Champion Cavalry. Deals x1.5 damage to Champion Units.

CivBonuses.Name: Scientific Adaptation
CivBonuses.History: The Romans were eager to adapt good ideas from their neighbours and enemies.
CivBonuses.Description: Structures, Ships and Siege Weapons +10% hit points for each phase researched.

CivBonuses.Name: Roman Legions
CivBonuses.History: The Romans were early to realise the potential of swords as the main infantry weapon.
CivBonuses.Description: Swordsmen are unlocked in the Town Phase.

CivBonuses.Name: Roman Citizenship
CivBonuses.History: Roman Citizenship was highly prized in the ancient world. Basic rights and privileges were afforded Roman citizens that were denied other conquered peoples. It is said that harming a Roman citizen was akin to harming Rome herself, and would cause the entire might of Rome to fall upon the perpetrator.
CivBonuses.Description: Civil Centres give units in range +10% attack.

TeamBonuses.Name: Socii
TeamBonuses.History: Roman allies, especially the Italian ones, often provided the majority of soldiers in Roman armies.
